Decentralization unlocks local governance and builds local trust.

Last week, and Ukrainian Institute had the great honour and joy of hosting a discussion on Community Resilience During Wartime with Tymofii Brik, a Ukrainian sociologist and the current Rector of the Kyiv School of Economics, at Leiden University - Institute of Public Administration.

🔍 Brik’s recent research explores 𝐡𝐨𝐰 𝐔𝐤𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐢𝐚𝐧 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐦𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐝𝐞𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐰𝐚𝐫, 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐚 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐚𝐫 𝐟𝐨𝐜𝐮𝐬 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐞𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐝𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐳𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐫𝐞𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐬.

One of the key outcomes of Ukraine’s 2015–2019 decentralization reform - which significantly expanded local autonomy and strong civic participation in budgeting - was a measurable increase in social capital. 

This transformation was critical in Ukraine’s wartime resilience. These decentralization reforms empowered local governance, fostered trust, and enabled communities not just to endure but to act with agency, strength, and effectiveness. 

Thank you Tymofii and the Ukrainian Institute for helping us hold this important talk and to all attendees for coming. It is through our diverse membership that ABBA aims to empower our communities, Ukrainian and otherwise, in The Netherlands and Europe.

We look forward to welcoming you back to other important discussions in the future!

📜 Danube’s waters flow under the dark sky, its surface barely disturbed as a heavy mist coils above it. The Bulgarian shore, a rugged stretch of marsh and fishing docks, bustles by day with trade and toil - boats ferrying goods, fishermen hauling in their catch, smugglers slipping unseen through the reeds. Official trade is slow, taxed into stagnation, but the river has always carried more than what is written on ledgers. You find yourselves aboard a crude wooden raft, its planks damp and creaking under the weight of smuggled cargo. Stacked crates, some marked, some suspiciously bare of any labels, shift slightly as the raft drifts down the current. How you ended up here is a matter of your own choices - or mistakes.
